intro: Dichaetanthera lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and has linear, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces distinctive, hairy anthers that aid in pollen dispersal. Dichaetanthera lancifolia is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
